name: Pope Sixtus IV
summary: Sixtus IV, born Francesco della Rovere, was Pope from 1471 to 1484. He was a great patron of the arts and commissioned the building of the Sistine Chapel, which is named after him. He established the Spanish Inquisition in 1478 at the request of Ferdinand and Isabella of Spain. He was known for nepotism, appointing many of his relatives to important positions. He authorized the use of torture in the Inquisition. He worked to strengthen the Papal States and engaged in various political intrigues. His pontificate was marked by both cultural achievement and political controversy.
